text: is there any Julia-way to generate warnings? I googled it and I can't seem to find a builtin way to generate a warning. Also, if this is indeed true, I would like to hear what the design philosophy behind this is

elements.text: is there any Julia-way to generate warnings? I googled it and I can't seem to find a builtin way to generate a warning. Also, if this is indeed true, I would like to hear what the design philosophy behind this is

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
What do you mean by generate warnings? Do you mean like the `@warn` macro?

elements.text: What do you mean by generate warnings? Do you mean like the

text:
```julia> @warn "this is a warning!"
┌ Warning: this is a warning!
└ @ Main REPL[21]:1```

elements.text:
julia> @warn "this is a warning!"
┌ Warning: this is a warning!
└ @ Main REPL[21]:1

text: aha, that's exactly what i wanted
